profile.pageDescription: Here's a summary of your farm's activity.
profile.earningsDescription: A summary of your earnings over the last 6 months.
profile.diagnosesDescription: Monitor the health of your crops.
profile.rentalsDescription: Keep track of equipment you're borrowing and lending.
cropDiagnosis.pageDescription: Upload an image of your crop to get an AI-powered diagnosis.
cropDiagnosis.descriptionPlaceholder: e.g., 'My tomato plants have yellow leaves with brown spots. The plant seems weak.'
cropDiagnosis.loadingText: AI is analyzing your crop. Please wait...
cropDiagnosis.noDisease: No significant disease detected based on the analysis.
cropDiagnosis.resultsPlaceholder: Your diagnosis results will appear here.
cropDiagnosis.missingInfoDesc: Please upload a photo and provide a description.
cropDiagnosis.notLoggedInDesc: You must be logged in to submit a diagnosis.
cropDiagnosis.savedDesc: Your crop diagnosis has been saved to your profile.
cropDiagnosis.fileReadErrorDesc: Could not read the selected file.
cropDiagnosis.failedDesc: An error occurred while analyzing the image.
mandi.pageDescription: Real-time market prices for various crops (per quintal).
equipmentRentals.pageDescription: Borrow or lend farm equipment with nearby farmers.
schemes.pageDescription: Explore government subsidies and check your eligibility.
schemes.pmk.title: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN)
schemes.pmk.description: A central sector scheme with 100% funding from the Government of India. It provides income support to all landholding farmer families.
schemes.pmk.e2: Family is defined as husband, wife and minor children.
schemes.pmk.application: Registration is done through the PM-KISAN portal (pmkisan.gov.in) or through Common Service Centres (CSCs). Requires Aadhaar, land records, and bank account details.
schemes.pmfby.title: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
schemes.pmfby.description: Provides comprehensive insurance coverage against crop failure, helping to stabilize the income of farmers.
schemes.pmfby.e1: All farmers including sharecroppers and tenant farmers growing notified crops in notified areas are eligible.
schemes.pmfby.e2: Loanee farmers are enrolled automatically by banks.
schemes.pmfby.application: Non-loanee farmers can enroll through the National Crop Insurance Portal (NCIP), nearest bank branch, or authorized insurance company.
schemes.kcc.title: Kisan Credit Card (KCC) Scheme
schemes.kcc.description: A scheme to provide farmers with timely access to credit for their cultivation and other needs.
schemes.kcc.e1: All farmers – individuals/joint borrowers who are owner cultivators.
schemes.kcc.e3: Self Help Groups (SHGs) or Joint Liability Groups (JLGs) of farmers.
schemes.kcc.application: Apply at any commercial bank, regional rural bank, or cooperative bank by filling out a simple one-page form. Requires land documents and a passport-sized photograph.
schemes.nmsa.title: National Mission for Sustainable Agriculture (NMSA)
schemes.nmsa.description: Aims to enhance agricultural productivity especially in rainfed areas focusing on integrated farming, water use efficiency, and soil health management.
schemes.nmsa.e2: Focus on small and marginal farmers.
schemes.nmsa.e3: Specific components may have additional criteria.
schemes.nmsa.application: Implemented by State Agriculture Departments. Farmers can contact their local Krishi Vigyan Kendra (KVK) or district agriculture office for details and application forms.
organics.pageDescription: Resources to help you transition to and succeed in organic farming.
organics.certDesc: Step-by-step guide to getting your farm certified as organic.
organics.pesticidesDesc: Learn how to create and use effective, all-natural pesticides.
organics.soilDesc: Techniques for composting and improving soil fertility without chemicals.
organics.marketDesc: Find buyers and markets specifically looking for organic produce.
organics.faq1q: How long does the transition to organic farming take?
organics.faq1a: The transition period, also known as the conversion period, typically takes two to three years, depending on the crop and past use of the land. During this time, you must follow organic practices, but your crops cannot be sold as 'certified organic'.
organics.faq2q: What are the main challenges of organic farming?
organics.faq2a: Key challenges include managing pests and weeds without synthetic chemicals, lower initial yields during the transition period, and potentially higher labor costs. However, organic produce often commands higher prices in the market.
organics.faq3q: Can I use cow dung as fertilizer?
organics.faq3a: Yes, composted cow dung is an excellent organic fertilizer. Raw manure should be composted for at least 3-4 months before application to kill pathogens and weed seeds.
organics.faq4q: What is crop rotation and why is it important?
organics.faq4a: Crop rotation is the practice of growing different types of crops in the same area in sequential seasons. It is crucial for managing soil fertility, reducing soil erosion, and helping to control pests and diseases.
help.pageDescription: We'd love to hear from you. Let us know how we can improve.
help.formDescription: Whether it's a bug report or a feature request, use this form to get in touch.
help.messagePlaceholder: Please describe the issue or your feedback in detail...
help.missingInfoDesc: Please fill in the subject and message.
help.errorDesc: An error occurred. Please try again.
alerts.title: Notifications
alerts.disease: Danger! A new strain of blight is spreading in your area. Take preventive measures immediately.
alerts.rainfall: Heavy rainfall expected tomorrow. Consider delaying irrigation.
alerts.priceDrop: Market Alert: Tomato prices are expected to drop by 15% next week.
alerts.newScheme: A new government subsidy for solar water pumps is now available. Check eligibility in Scheme Navigator.
